page.title: 11THE SOMERSET GUARDIAN.
page.content: We have taken the local paper, the Somerset and Avon Guardian of the week ending July the 12th 1985.The main headline was the continuing problem of the traffic in the centre of Radstock. There are now no traffic lights on, they switched them off and are building two mini roundabouts.The other problem is that they are only installing one pedestrian crossing to the four that were already there.Many people are angry about this and have contacted the local MP. Avon County Council are arranging a meeting with the Norton Radstock District Chamber of Commerce to discuss the possible increase of the rates next year.Which could mean loss of jobs. People in Radstock are thinking about turning an old mining office in Radstock into a museum.First the
